Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Brevinin-2-RN1 (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Active against S. aureus ATCC25923, S. aureus ATCC43300 (MIC 3.1 uM), B. subtilis (MIC 12.5 uM), Gram- E. coli ML-35P, P. aeruginosa PA01, P. aeruginosa ATCC27853 (MIC 12.5-25 uM), and  C. albicans ATCC2002 (MIC 6.25 uM).  Rabbit red blood cell hemolysis 17% at 100 uM. Found in multiple species. Updated 5/2020 GW
Literature Information.Author: Liu X, Liu R, Wei L, Yang H, Zhang K, Liu J, Lai R.2011
Literature Information.Reference: J Pept Sci. 2011 Jan;17(1):68-72. doi: 10.1002/psc.1309. Epub 2010 Oct 25.PubMed.
Literature Information.Title: Two novel antimicrobial peptides from skin secretions of the frog, Rana nigrovittata
